author: kfogel
msg: (upgrade_from_above): New XFail test for Alexander Sinyushkin's bug.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/svn/cl.h: Formatting changes only; no logic changes.

author: kameshj
msg: Call 'discover_and_merge_children' iff URL1 and URL2 are same.

author: cmpilato
msg: Optimize away some network traffic from svn_client__get_repos_root()
by allowing callers to pass in an adm_access baton so repository root
URLs can be read from entries files.
this function to optimize out unnecessary RA interactions.

author: kameshj
msg: Fix for the bug introduced since r25933:
Prior to r25933 for a long time we pass both URLs to be same for
as we resolved peg_revisions inside 'do_single_file_merge' and we get two
different URLs and things were working well.
r25933 resolves peg revisions earlier, i.e before 'do_single_file_merge' and
'do_merge'. So this causes 'do_single_file_merge' not aware of 'URL2' and
copied from file:///repo/trunk at rev rX committed at rX+50) to a single
file target for the range rX+5:X+60 causes the mergeinfo to be recorded from
'/trunk' whereas nothing should be recorded as 2 different urls are involved.
